meanings.definition: A person who holds the theological doctrine of modalism.
meanings.sent1: The modalist explained his belief in one God with different modes.
meanings.sent2: The church had a debate about whether a modalist view was acceptable.
meanings.sent3: At the theological conference, the modalist and the trinitarian walked into a bar.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of God was like a modalist painting, blending different aspects into one.
meanings.sent5: The modalist's conviction in the unity of God was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the theological doctrine of modalism.
meanings.sent1: The modalist interpretation of the scripture was controversial.
meanings.sent2: The modalist perspective on the Trinity differed from traditional views.
meanings.sent3: The modalist argument was so convincing that it converted many skeptics.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was described as modalist, seamlessly integrating diverse ideas.
meanings.sent5: The modalist symbolism in the artwork was subtle yet profound.
